channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Beyond FVD: Enhanced Evaluation Metrics for Video Generation Quality
item.description: The Fr\'echet Video Distance (FVD) is a widely adopted metric for evaluating video generation distribution quality.

item.title: CAR: Controllable Autoregressive Modeling for Visual Generation
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, we are the first to propose a control framework for pre-trained autoregressive visual generation models.

item.title: Improved detection of discarded fish species through BoxAL active learning
item.description: Additionally, we showed that epistemic certainty is a suitable method to sample images that the current iteration of the model cannot deal with yet.

item.title: SELECT: A Large-Scale Benchmark of Data Curation Strategies for Image Classification
item.description: In this work, we take steps towards a formal evaluation of data curation strategies and introduce SELECT, the first large-scale benchmark of curation strategies for image classification.

item.title: PrefixQuant: Static Quantization Beats Dynamic through Prefixed Outliers in LLMs
item.description: Specifically, PrefixQuant identifies high-frequency outlier tokens and prefixes them in the KV cache, preventing the generation of outlier tokens during inference and simplifying quantization.

item.title: A Strategy for Label Alignment in Deep Neural Networks
item.description: One recent research demonstrated successful application of the label alignment property for unsupervised domain adaptation in a linear regression settings.

item.title: Mitigating Modality Prior-Induced Hallucinations in Multimodal Large Language Models via Deciphering Attention Causality
item.description: These biases arise from the visual encoder and the Large Language Model (LLM) backbone, affecting the attention mechanism responsible for aligning multimodal inputs.

item.title: FreSh: Frequency Shifting for Accelerated Neural Representation Learning
item.description: Implicit Neural Representations (INRs) have recently gained attention as a powerful approach for continuously representing signals such as images, videos, and 3D shapes using multilayer perceptrons (MLPs).

item.title: TuneVLSeg: Prompt Tuning Benchmark for Vision-Language Segmentation Models
item.description: This work presents an open-source benchmarking framework, TuneVLSeg, to integrate various unimodal and multimodal prompt tuning techniques into VLSMs, making prompt tuning usable for downstream segmentation datasets with any number of classes.

item.title: DreamSat: Towards a General 3D Model for Novel View Synthesis of Space Objects
item.description: In this work, we explore the generalization abilities of these reconstruction techniques, aiming to avoid the necessity of retraining for each new scene, by presenting a novel approach to 3D spacecraft reconstruction from single-view images, DreamSat, by fine-tuning the Zero123 XL, a state-of-the-art single-view reconstruction model, on a high-quality dataset of 190 high-quality spacecraft models and integrating it into the DreamGaussian framework.

item.title: Regression Conformal Prediction under Bias
item.description: Specifically for absolute residual and quantile-based non-conformity scores, we prove: 1) the upper bound of symmetrically adjusted interval lengths increases by $2|b|$ where $b$ is a globally applied scalar value representing bias, 2) asymmetrically adjusted interval lengths are not affected by bias, and 3) conditions when asymmetrically adjusted interval lengths are guaranteed to be smaller than symmetric ones.

item.title: Fine-Tuning CLIP's Last Visual Projector: A Few-Shot Cornucopia
item.description: We consider the problem of adapting a contrastively pretrained vision-language model like CLIP (Radford et al., 2021) for few-shot classification.

item.title: RoWeeder: Unsupervised Weed Mapping through Crop-Row Detection
item.description: Precision agriculture relies heavily on effective weed management to ensure robust crop yields.

item.title: Forgetting Curve: A Reliable Method for Evaluating Memorization Capability for Long-context Models
item.description: We provide an extensive survey for limitations in this work and propose a new method called forgetting curve to measure the memorization capability of long-context models.

item.title: MIBench: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Model Inversion Attack and Defense
item.description: Model Inversion (MI) attacks aim at leveraging the output information of target models to reconstruct privacy-sensitive training data, raising widespread concerns on privacy threats of Deep Neural Networks (DNNs).

item.title: PRFusion: Toward Effective and Robust Multi-Modal Place Recognition with Image and Point Cloud Fusion
item.description: We propose two multi-modal place recognition models, namely PRFusion and PRFusion++.

item.title: ProtoNAM: Prototypical Neural Additive Models for Interpretable Deep Tabular Learning
item.description: In this work, we propose a new deep tabular learning method, termed Prototypical Neural Additive Model (ProtoNAM), which introduces prototypes into neural networks in the framework of GAMs.

item.title: Preserving Multi-Modal Capabilities of Pre-trained VLMs for Improving Vision-Linguistic Compositionality
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new method to enhance compositional understanding in pre-trained vision and language models (VLMs) without sacrificing performance in zero-shot multi-modal tasks.

item.title: SePPO: Semi-Policy Preference Optimization for Diffusion Alignment
item.description: To address the limitations of both on- and off-policy RLHF, we propose a preference optimization method that aligns DMs with preferences without relying on reward models or paired human-annotated data.

item.title: PredFormer: Transformers Are Effective Spatial-Temporal Predictive Learners
item.description: On Moving MNIST, PredFormer achieves a 51. 3% reduction in MSE relative to SimVP.

item.title: HyperINF: Unleashing the HyperPower of the Schulz's Method for Data Influence Estimation
item.description: The family of hyperpower methods are well-known for their rigorous convergence guarantees on matrix inverse approximation, while the matrix multiplication operation can involve intractable memory and computation costs on large-scale models.

item.title: TimeBridge: Non-Stationarity Matters for Long-term Time Series Forecasting
item.description: Eliminating non-stationarity is essential for avoiding spurious regressions and capturing local dependencies in short-term modeling, while preserving it is crucial for revealing long-term cointegration across variates.

item.title: MindScope: Exploring cognitive biases in large language models through Multi-Agent Systems
item.description: The dynamic component leverages a rule-based, multi-agent communication framework to facilitate the generation of multi-round dialogues.

item.title: SparseVLM: Visual Token Sparsification for Efficient Vision-Language Model Inference
item.description: In vision-language models (VLMs), visual tokens usually consume a significant amount of computational overhead, despite their sparser information density compared to text tokens.

item.title: DAdEE: Unsupervised Domain Adaptation in Early Exit PLMs
item.description: Experiments on tasks such as sentiment analysis, entailment classification, and natural language inference demonstrate that DADEE consistently outperforms not only early exit methods but also various domain adaptation methods under domain shift scenarios.

item.title: Regressing the Relative Future: Efficient Policy Optimization for Multi-turn RLHF
item.description: Such approaches suffer from covariate shift: the conversations in the training set have previous turns generated by some reference policy, which means that low training error may not necessarily correspond to good performance when the learner is actually in the conversation loop.

item.title: BrainCodec: Neural fMRI codec for the decoding of cognitive brain states
item.description: Recently, leveraging big data in deep learning has led to significant performance improvements, as confirmed in applications like mental state decoding using fMRI data.

item.title: Enhancing 3D Human Pose Estimation Amidst Severe Occlusion with Dual Transformer Fusion
item.description: In the field of 3D Human Pose Estimation from monocular videos, the presence of diverse occlusion types presents a formidable challenge.

item.title: Multimodal 3D Fusion and In-Situ Learning for Spatially Aware AI
item.description: Seamless integration of virtual and physical worlds in augmented reality benefits from the system semantically "understanding" the physical environment.

item.title: Leveraging Large Language Models for Suicide Detection on Social Media with Limited Labels
item.description: Our analysis shows that the choice of LLMs affects the prompting performance, with larger models providing better accuracy.

item.title: SONAR: A Synthetic AI-Audio Detection Framework~and Benchmark
item.description: In this paper, we introduce SONAR, a synthetic AI-Audio Detection Framework and Benchmark, aiming to provide a comprehensive evaluation for distinguishing cutting-edge AI-synthesized auditory content.

item.title: CAPEEN: Image Captioning with Early Exits and Knowledge Distillation
item.description: Deep neural networks (DNNs) have made significant progress in recognizing visual elements and generating descriptive text in image-captioning tasks.

item.title: MVP-Bench: Can Large Vision--Language Models Conduct Multi-level Visual Perception Like Humans?
item.description: Furthermore, the performance gap between natural and manipulated images indicates that current LVLMs do not generalize in understanding the visual semantics of synthetic images as humans do.

item.title: Multi-Tiered Self-Contrastive Learning for Medical Microwave Radiometry (MWR) Breast Cancer Detection
item.description: The pursuit of enhanced breast cancer detection and monitoring techniques is a paramount healthcare objective, driving the need for innovative imaging technologies and diagnostic approaches.

item.title: Algorithmic Capabilities of Random Transformers
item.description: Trained transformer models have been found to implement interpretable procedures for tasks like arithmetic and associative recall, but little is understood about how the circuits that implement these procedures originate during training.

item.title: AdaptDiff: Cross-Modality Domain Adaptation via Weak Conditional Semantic Diffusion for Retinal Vessel Segmentation
item.description: Subsequently, we sample on the target domain with binary vessel masks from the source domain to get paired data, i. e., target domain synthetic images conditioned on the binary vessel map.

item.title: $\texttt{dattri}$: A Library for Efficient Data Attribution
item.description: Using the developed $\texttt{dattri}$ library, we are able to perform a comprehensive and fair benchmark analysis across a wide range of data attribution methods.

item.title: Optimising for the Unknown: Domain Alignment for Cephalometric Landmark Detection
item.description: Cephalometric Landmark Detection is the process of identifying key areas for cephalometry.

item.title: Ordinal Preference Optimization: Aligning Human Preferences via NDCG
item.description: In this work, we propose a novel listwise approach named Ordinal Preference Optimization (OPO), which employs the Normalized Discounted Cumulative Gain (NDCG), a widely-used ranking metric, to better utilize relative proximity within ordinal multiple responses.

item.title: Data Distribution Valuation
item.description: Data valuation is a class of techniques for quantitatively assessing the value of data for applications like pricing in data marketplaces.

item.title: CS4: Measuring the Creativity of Large Language Models Automatically by Controlling the Number of Story-Writing Constraints
item.description: Additionally, our experiments on OLMo suggest that Learning from Human Feedback (LHF) can help LLMs select better stories from their training data but has limited influence in boosting LLMs' ability to produce creative stories that are unseen in the training corpora.

item.title: DB-SAM: Delving into High Quality Universal Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: On 21 3D medical image segmentation tasks, our proposed DB-SAM achieves an absolute gain of 8. 8%, compared to a recent medical SAM adapter in the literature.

item.title: Mechanistic Behavior Editing of Language Models
item.description: Large Language Models trained on web-scale text acquire language generation abilities that can solve a wide range of tasks, particularly when task knowledge is refined into the generative prior using in-context examples.

item.title: Improving Temporal Link Prediction via Temporal Walk Matrix Projection
item.description: Temporal link prediction, aiming at predicting future interactions among entities based on historical interactions, is crucial for a series of real-world applications.

item.title: Cross Resolution Encoding-Decoding For Detection Transformers
item.description: In this paper, we propose a Cross-Resolution Encoding-Decoding (CRED) mechanism that allows DETR to achieve the accuracy of high-resolution detection while having the speed of low-resolution detection.

item.title: Is Score Matching Suitable for Estimating Point Processes?
item.description: Score matching estimators have gained widespread attention in recent years partly because they are free from calculating the integral of normalizing constant, thereby addressing the computational challenges in maximum likelihood estimation (MLE).

item.title: Neuron-Level Sequential Editing for Large Language Models
item.description: This work explores sequential model editing in large language models (LLMs), a critical task that involves modifying internal knowledge within LLMs continuously through multi-round editing, each incorporating updates or corrections to adjust the model outputs without the need for costly retraining.

item.title: Distillation-Free One-Step Diffusion for Real-World Image Super-Resolution
item.description: However, these methods incur substantial training costs and may constrain the performance of the student model by the teacher's limitations.

item.title: TUBench: Benchmarking Large Vision-Language Models on Trustworthiness with Unanswerable Questions
item.description: Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) have achieved remarkable progress on visual perception and linguistic interpretation.

item.title: Test-Time Adaptation for Keypoint-Based Spacecraft Pose Estimation Based on Predicted-View Synthesis
item.description: Due to the difficulty of replicating the real conditions during training, supervised algorithms for spacecraft pose estimation experience a drop in performance when trained on synthetic data and applied to real operational data.
